would do if we were in the shoes of mortek i and ester who suddenly have been given a blank check by king zirksies to somehow solve a problem of his making and that he signed off he authorized an edict that said that on a given day the whole Persian populist can turn on the jews and kill all of them and take all of their stuff very bad edict now the chief architect behind that edict has been impaled and he's outside the window up there rotten on a stick pretty ugly situation but we can't be thinking about that gore and violence right now we gotta think about how we get the word out with this new edict to not undercut the existing edict to be can't just countermand it directly you gotta find some clever way with words right new edict that will bring about effectively uh... frustration of the intention of the previous edict while saving face for the can't very very delicate very tricky and i asked you for feedback on that i got a whole bunch thank you for that by the way most of that came in over on the sub-read it and read it dot com r slash t m b h podcast is where we've had a lot of the conversation over the years for this podcast i do think that is probably about to change patreon where a lot of you support the program has opened things up so now there's an option to have an unpaid membership and it's different than the paid membership still gives you know perks and bonuses and stuff to say thank you to those who are kicking in you make it so it's a kind of place where everybody can participate in the discussion and you just move all of your discussion over there really encouraging that they want to make patreon the hub for supporting and even non-supporting members of the community around different podcast and youtube channels and stuff and still learn how all that works but in the meantime for a long time we've been on reddit and that's a place where crazy things can happen but not really in our little corner of it because you are awesome and i don't know if i tell you that enough if you totally realize it but when you get this many people together on the internet and then talk about religious things we're supposed to hate each other and cannibalize each other we're supposed to have all kinds of incidents and weird name cut just stupid stuff and we don't have any of that you are great to each other and i wish i could hold up and show the whole world and be like hey it could be like this y'all to check out these people there wonderful but i don't know the internet's a big place to point is i see it i don't know who else does but i see it and you'll handle your business wonderfully i really like your internet game i like your style or there on reddit in this particular discussion a bunch you throughout ideas for what you think you might write if you were mortik and ester one common thread was to bog the whole thing down with bureaucratic requirements like licenses to participate or background checks that take ten months to get through which would then render the whole event mood because that's longer than the amount of time before the scheduled event that haman put together so many of you proposed bureaucracy as a way to bog the whole thing down some others of you proposed more of a carrot approach to writing the c tikt instead of the stick like a will give you money from the state of haman to not participate or will give any of the jews or anyone wants to defend the jews on that day a really nice fresh set of armor and weaponry which would be worth a whole bunch of money funded by haman's estate and made by the king's blacksmiths of that was a pretty clever idea but it seemed like the general theme for most of your responses was yeah yeah this is a tricky one this is not going to be easy to solve so yesterday we looked at how mortik i and ester framed things up and we discovered that it's a carbon copy it's an exact match of how haman drew things up and how we distributed the original edict so again we're getting that sense of symmetry and balance throughout this book if at any point in our conversations by the way you're like there's so much symmetry and balance in this book when are we going to go and just cash in all of that to see all of the structure and its beauty the answer is i'm not forgetting that we're going to do it at the end when we have the whole thing in front of us so it's just yeah we got a pin in that one trust me and so we've got this matching approach to how to write it and who distribute the messages to except that the jews are now included their cc'd on the email by mortik i and ester making them participants recipients of the command instead of the direct objects of the command as it was under haman so this then is what the edict says ester eight verse eleven the king's edict written by mortik i and ester granted the jews in every city the right to assemble and to protect themselves to destroy kill and annihilate any armed force or any nationality or province that might attack them and their women and children and to plunder the property of their enemies the day appointed for the jews to do this and all the provinces of king xerxes was the thirteenth day of the twelfth month the month of a dar a copy of the text of the edict was to be issued as law in every province and made known to the people of every nationality so that the jews would be ready on that day to avenge themselves on their enemies okay so this edict pertains to one day just the exact same way the other one pertained to one day they pertain to the same day there's more symmetry there and there's even more symmetry yet and that the other edict says kill all the jews and this edict says hey jews fight back and kill everybody who's trying to kill you now this is not super fun it's not light material it's a tragedy really because the insecurity and bumbling this and the dynastic baggage of the achaemenid empire that xerxes carries with him after four generations of leadership it's created this bizarre catch twenty two where this is a war entirely created by the throne think about it nobody had leave to go and kill another people group inside the boundaries of pergia pergia was proud of its cosmopolitan diverse nature pergia thought diversity was its strength kind of and nobody was authorized to do anything you couldn't get away with stuff like this it was one of those nobody colon nothing kind of things and then the throne from susa colon go ahead and kill all the jews what really oh and keep their stuff amazing said some people and they would just say it and then it happens cost a ton of money to do this a lot of man hours involved now they're sending out another one this says it should not just be a massacre it should be a war was like all right well we're gonna kill i mean i can't even joke about this i can't even pick a people group within society there's no way for me to play this so where you know you're gonna kill edicts are just for everybody not even just fighting men or anybody who's armed just anybody can you imagine and the this is sanity what's about to go down here i think this is one of those places where the twenty five hundred years it exists between right now as we're thinking these thoughts together and back then that twenty five hundred years sort of softens this it feels like a savagier
